# applicationActivated

**Type Property**

This notification is posted after the app has been activated. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.

## Declaration

```swift
static let applicationActivated: NSAccessibility.Notification
```

## Notification names

- **announcementRequested**: This notification is posted whenever an accessibility element needs to make an announcement to the user. This notification requires a `userInfo` dictionary with the key [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/NotificationUserInfoKey/announcement] and a localized string containing the announcement. To help an assistive app determine the importance of the announcement, add the appropriate [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/NotificationUserInfoKey/priority] to the `userInfo` dictionary.
- **applicationDeactivated**: This notification is posted after the app has been deactivated.  Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **applicationHidden**: This notification is posted after the app is hidden. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **applicationShown**: This notification is posted after the app is shown. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **created**: This notification is posted after an accessibility element is created. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **drawerCreated**: This notification is posted after a drawer appears. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **focusedUIElementChanged**: This notification is posted after an accessibility element gains focus. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **focusedWindowChanged**: This notification is posted after the key window changes. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **helpTagCreated**: This notification is posted after a help tag appears. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **layoutChanged**: This notification is posted after the UI changes in a way that requires the attention of an accessibility client. This notification should be accompanied by a `userInfo` dictionary with the key [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/NotificationUserInfoKey/uiElements] and an array containing the UI elements that have been added or changed. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **mainWindowChanged**: This notification is posted after the main window changes. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **moved**: This notification is posted after an accessibility element moves. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **resized**: This notification is posted after an accessibility element’s size changes. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **rowCollapsed**: This notification is posted after a row collapses. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
- **rowCountChanged**: This notification is posted after a row is added or deleted. Post this notification using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/post(element:notification:)] function instead of an `NSNotificationCenter` instance.
